ferro.description: Find iron ore in riverbeds with reddish stones (bog iron). Crush, wash out impurities, and use a clay furnace with charcoal to reduce oxides to metallic iron (bloom). Use stone hammers to forge tools.

carbono.description: Make charcoal by stacking wood in a clay pit and limiting air. Light the wood and keep a smoldering burn for days. This charcoal serves as a high-heat fuel.

aco.description: Steel is made by carburizing iron in simple furnaces. Under low-oxygen conditions, bury pieces of iron in charcoal and heat to infuse carbon. You can use clay molds to shape blades, tools and structural parts.
